intro: Oxytropis javaherdehi, commonly known as the Java oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its erect growth habit and is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Oxytropis javaherdehi is adapted to survive in nutrient-poor soils and can often be found in rocky or sandy habitats.
